description:
It's 1863, the twilight of the shogunate, and Japan is on the cusp of monumental change. The streets of the nation's capital are soaked in blood as political upheaval and rising tensions between masterless, wandering ronin and government samurai set the stage for one of the most turbulent times in Japan's history. Young orphan Nio is no stranger to the harsh realities of the world, and yet he can't help but cling to his burning passion for justice and desire to change the world for the better.

One day, he crosses paths with two men who will become central figures of the coming revolution: Hijikata Toshizo and Okita Souji, two of the founding members of a group of hated ronin known as the Miburo—who would later become known as the Shinsengumi. Inspired by the efforts of the so-called "Blues Wolves of Mibu," Nio decides to join the ranks to help carve a path to the world he wishes to see. But with new betrayals and reversals every day, will Nio be able to stay true to his conscience?

(Source: Kodansha USA, edited)

node.description:
__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

Spyair (stylized as SPYAIR) is a Japanese rock band from Nagoya, Japan, formed in 2005. The band currently consists of Hidefumi "Ike" Ikeda (vocals, former), Yuji "UZ" Nakai (guitar, programming), Kenji "Momiken" Momiyama (bass guitar, leader) and Kenta Sasabe (drums). The band's name, SPYAIR, was determined in one shot by the members, which came from the word spyware, a type of computer virus.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/umeda_cypher) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/CodaHTiSd0d) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRJL3BrWVc-ypwXSBprk-1g) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@umeda_cypher) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2yx4K2BgLQjIPPT1IodR6Y)

__Introduction:__
Umeda Cypher is a Japanese hip-hop group that consists of various rappers, MCs, DJs and music producers. The group originates from cyphers that were held at the Osaka and Umeda stations alongside its participants. 

The first meet dates back to May 19, 2007, when one of the original members Funk said he wanted to rap more, so he and two of the other original members H.YOROZU and akiramen plus other participants orchestrated a cypher every saturday night at the pedestrian bridge connecting the Hanshin Department Store and Hankyu Department Store in Umeda.

__Members:__
- KBD (古武道) – rapper
- peko – rapper
- KZ – rapper
- KennyDoes (ケニーダズ), alternatively known as Doiken (ドイケン) – rapper
- [R-Shitei](https://anilist.co/staff/207162/RShitei) (R-指定) – rapper
- KOPERU (コペル) – rapper
- TAKE-M (テークエム) – rapper
- teppei – rapper
- HATCH (ハチ) – rapper
- Cosaqu (コーサク) – rapper, DJ, producer
- ILL SWAG GAGA – rapper
- DJ SPI-K – DJ
- Cola (コーラ) – rapper
- Tamakou (たまこう), alternatively known as Kousuke Tamai (タマイコウスケ) – rapper
- AO – rapper
- MCRIBBON (MCりぼん) – rapper
- Lard (ラード) – rapper
- Rei (レイ) – rapper
- PEPPEBOMB (ペッペBOMB) – rapper

__Former Members:__
- OSCA, alternatively known as Yoshihiro Komatsu (コマツヨシヒロ) – rapper
- tella, alternatively known as GeckoTribe – rapper
- Taurin (たうりん) – rapper
- Funk (ふぁんく) – rapper
- akiramen (あきらめん) – rapper
- H.YOROZU – rapper
